name: Infrastructure
description: You've survived a few days, can you go longer?

quests.name: SieveTastic
quests.description: Some resources can only be extracted by sieving blocks, insert the mesh into the empty sieve and right-click siftable blocks to grab resources.

quests.name: Drill It
quests.description: The Drill will make your life a lot easier while mining. Make sure to fill the drill up with power before use! ALSO! You can have a pink one if you want!

quests.name: Clay Transmogrify
quests.description: The extra Clay you have laying around your base can be reconstructed into Lapis using the Atomic Reconstructor.

quests.name: Pulverize It!
quests.description: Electrical Machines are a bit far off, use this Pulvus to pulverize items using burnable fuels.

quests.name: I Just Shipped My Pants!
quests.description: Do you have a bunch of unused crops?! Do you need more Emeralds?! Well, look no further! The Shipping Bin will buy all your unwanted crops and give you Emeralds in return!

quests.name: Bind It
quests.description: Conduit Binder is needed for advanced pipes. Craft some Binder Composite and cook it in a furnace to obtain the finished product.

quests.name: Burn It With Lasers!
quests.description: The Atomic Reconstructor is a great way to convert items into more useful items! Make sure it has power and either place or throw items in front of it.

quests.name: Cactus Rocks
quests.description: Cactus Green is the main ingredient in coloring a circuit board. If it's not green it just won't work! You'll find Cactus out in the wild in a number of sandy biomes.

quests.name: Blasted!
quests.description: If you want to further your research, you're going to need Steel. The Blast Furnace takes a total of 27 Blast Bricks. Use a Blast Furnace to cook Coal Coke and Iron into Steel. Blast Bricks should be placed in a 3x3x3 cube and right-clicked with an Engineer's Hammer to create the multi-block structure.

quests.name: Power Cells
quests.description: As you progress, you will need machines to power your base. The easiest power source to begin with is a furnace generator. It will turn most burnable items into power for your first set of machines.

quests.name: To Catch A Soul
quests.description: Use this magical bottle to capture the souls of your enemies.

quests.name: Upgrade Your Pipes
quests.description: Now that you have some Binder Composite and a bunch of storage, you can make use of some Item Conduits to move things around.

quests.name: Frickin Laser Beams
quests.description: Looking for some real power?! How about a Laser Turret. Put this inside your base and those Raiders won't know what hit them.

quests.name: Alloy Hoy!
quests.description: Acquiring Alloys is necessary to further your infrastructure. Start off by pulverizing some iron and nickel to make invar.

quests.name: Evil Sand
quests.description: Take the souls of your enemies and bury them into sand to transform the block into Soul Sand. Soul Sand is able to be sifted for items.

quests.name: Press It Real Good
quests.description: Alright, you have access to Steel and the Metal Plate Mold. Open up your Engineer's Manual to learn how to create a Metal Press. This multi-block structure needs power and the mold inserted to work properly. It's also used to create metal wires at a much more rapid and efficient pace.

quests.name: Lock, Stock, and Barrel
quests.description: Need a way to get ahold of Netherrack or Obsidian? Use the Stone Barrel. Right-click redstone on a barrel filled with lava to create netherrack and place a source of water above the barrel to turn it into obsidian.

quests.name: Compact Your Automation
quests.description: Compact machines are in need of a Chassis, build your first to begin work on smaller machines and save some space in your base.

quests.name: Water You Doing?
quests.description: Crops can take quite a while to grow on their own. You'll need a watering can to help them grow a  bit faster! Don't forget to fill it with water first.

quests.name: Upgrade Your Defenses
quests.description: Your junk-firing turret worked nicely at first, but you've probably noticed enemies are getting progressively harder. Start upgrading your turrets to do more damage and take care of enemies!

quests.name: Grind It Up
quests.description: Pulvus eating all your fuel? No worries! Use the SAG Mill to use electricity instead. This will also work at a much faster pace and increase your access to new materials.

quests.name: Lock and Key
quests.description: You seem to be getting a lot of random junk in your trunks. Time to upgrade to drawers and get a storage system going!

quests.name: Crushed Conversion
quests.description: You might be in need of extra Emeralds or Diamonds. Use the Atomic Reconstructor to convert Crushed Diamonds into Crushed Emeralds and back!

quests.name: Empower For More Power
quests.description: The Empowerer will... Empower your items to their full potential. Check out the Actually Additions Manual to learn the proper setup. Don't forget, each item stand needs to be powered. Good luck and don't blow yourself up!

quests.name: Tanks A Lot!
quests.description: Moving fluids around 1 bucket at a time is pretty inefficient. Grab a tank to move them around at a much faster rate!

quests.name: Guns A Blazin'
quests.description: You'll need Gunpowder as a crafting material and it looks like all the Creepers are gone. Look up the recipe and produce some Gunpowder to begin storing some for later.

quests.name: Chop Chop
quests.description: As you may have noticed, diamonds are a little limited. If you put a block of Coal Coke on a Chopping Block and strike it with an Axe, you'll probably find Diamond Nuggets!

quests.name: Alloy Hoy!
quests.description: When you need to create unique alloys, the Alloy Smelter is a perfect addition to your base. Remember to set the mode in the GUI for the proper type of smelting.

quests.name: The Transporter
quests.description: Moving filled chests and drawers is a pain. But, if you act now you can move full inventories with the Chest Transporter!

quests.name: Treated Wood
quests.description: Treated Wood is another crafting material needed for a number of recipes. Use the Creosote Oil you have acquired to treat planks and obtain Treated Wood. You can break it down into sticks if needed.

quests.name: Defend Your Ramp!
quests.description: When powered, the Disposable Item Turret will fire any item as a projectile. Be careful, the damage output is pretty low!

quests.name: String Of Pearls
quests.description: Seeking out Herobrine for Ender Pearls may not be a safe way, so instead, you can try and grow your own! Fill the Stone Barrel with Lava and right-click on it with Glowstone to create End Stone. Then plant the Ender Lily on top to start growing!

quests.name: Steel The Night!
quests.description: Start your Blast Furnace up and acquire some Steel Ingots!

quests.name: Tough As Nails
quests.description: Obsidian is a tough material that's blast resistant. You may want to grab a bunch to protect yourself! Obsidian can be obtained in the world, or by placing a water source above a Barrel filled with Lava.

quests.name: Fuel Reserves
quests.description: Coal Coke has an increased cooking time, this will help increase the amount of available fuel in storage. Coal Coke can also be obtained through cooking Logs into Charcoal and then again to Coal Coke.

quests.name: Shots Fired!
quests.description: Bows and Crossbows aren't cutting it anymore. It's time to step up your game with a Revolver!

quests.name: Oil Extraction
quests.description: Creosote Oil is necesary for a number of recipes, including fused quartz. Get yourself a few bottles to begin crafting.

quests.name: Redstone Shortage
quests.description: It seems like Redstone is a bit short these days. You'll have to take some of these Orchids and try to grow some instead. Plant the Orchids on Redstone Ore Blocks to grow Redstone Dust.

quests.name: Cook That Coal
quests.description: Cook That Coal. The Coke Oven needs 27 Total Coke Bricks in a 3x3x3 structure. Then, right-click using the Engineer's Hammer to convert it into a Coke Oven.

quests.name: Nether Stuffs
quests.description: The Nether has been shut down until further notice leaving you only able to craft netherrack. Use the barrel method to acquire some netherrack which can also be cooked into Nether Bricks for recipes.

quests.name: Metal Plates
quests.description: As you've noticed, Metal Plates are needed for many important recipes. The first thing you'll need is the Plate Mold for the Metal Press Multi-Block structure.

quests.name: Let Me Transfer You
quests.description: Now that you're progressing a bit more and decorating your base, you'll want some pipes to move liquids around. Use the transfer nodes and pipes to help out!

quests.name: Rise Up Lights!
quests.description: Razor Wire is an upgraded type of Barbed Wire that can be electrified to provide defenses for your base! (Need to move your Barbed Wire? Use the Engineer's Wire Cutters)

quests.name: Read The Manual!
quests.description: If you want to increase your productivity, you'll need this manual to study up on the machines you'll have to build. Keep it safe!

quests.name: A Metal Bucket
quests.description: Clay Buckets aren't cutting it anymore, you'll want something a little more durable. Use your new Metal Press machine to create the necessary resources for a Metal Bucket.

quests.name: AmmuNation
quests.description: You'll need to load up your new Revolver with some powerful ammo. Craft the Armor Piercing Cartridge using the Engineer's Workbench and the Common Projectiles blueprint.
